description: A ifJnxErrors notification is sent when the value
of ifJnxCrcErrors or ifJnxFcsErrors increases.

event.Summary: Error count increased; CRC errors: $v1; FCS errors: $v2

description: CRC Errors: The number of CRC errors
variables.name: JUNIPER-IF-MIB::ifJnxCrcErrors

description: FCS Errors: The number of FCS errors
variables.name: JUNIPER-IF-MIB::ifJnxFcsErrors

description: A ifJnxL2Errors notification is sent when the value
of ifJnxInL2ChanErrors increases.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD JUNIPER-IF-MIB::ifJnxL2Errors JUNIPER-IF-MIB::ifJnxInL2ChanErrors C 9999 JUNIPER-IF-MIB::ifChassisFpc i 9999 JUNIPER-IF-MIB::ifChassisPic i 9999 JUNIPER-IF-MIB::ifChassisPort i 9999

description: L2 channel errors: the number of incoming packets for which
the sofware could not find a valid logical interface.
variables.name: JUNIPER-IF-MIB::ifJnxInL2ChanErrors

description: The number of the FPC card on which the interface
is located in the chassis. It is the chassis slot
in which the FPC card is installed for the specified
interface.
Although the number is labeled from 0 and up in the
chassis, the return value for this object always starts
from 1 according to Network Management convention.
Therefore, a value of zero means there is no real or
physical FPC associated with the specified interface.
variables.name: JUNIPER-IF-MIB::ifChassisFpc

description: The number of the PIC card on which the interface
is located in the chassis. It is the PIC location
on the FPC card for the specified interface.
Although the number is labeled from 0 and up in the
chassis, the return value for this object always starts
from 1 according to Network Management convention.
Therefore, a value of zero means there is no real or
physical PIC associated with the specified interface.
variables.name: JUNIPER-IF-MIB::ifChassisPic

description: The number of the port on the PIC card on which the
interface is located in the chassis. It is the port
number on the PIC card for the specified interface.
Although the number is labeled from 0 and up in the
chassis, the return value for this object always starts
from 1 according to Network Management convention.
Therefore, a value of zero means there is no real or
physical port associated with the specified interface.
variables.name: JUNIPER-IF-MIB::ifChassisPort
